alert.note: Alert for Humphreys (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 25 at 10:31AM CST until February 28 at 11:08PM CST by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Tennessee... Duck River Near Hurricane Mills affecting Humphreys County. For the Duck River...including Hurricane Mills...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE MONDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Duck River Near Hurricane Mills. * WHEN...Until late Monday evening. * IMPACTS...At 24.0 feet, Agricultural land and other areas near the river are extensively flooded from Bucksnort to Taylortown, Cedar Grove, and to Bakerville Rd. Flood waters approach roads near the river, including Hurricane Mills Rd, Old Hwy 13 between Cedar Grove and Forks of the River Rd, Forks of the River Rd between Blue Creek Rd, Pumpkin Creek Rd, and near the Link Farm State Archaeological Area, Dyer Rd, and Tumbling Creek Rd. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 AM CST Friday the stage was 24.7 feet and falling. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:00 AM CST Friday was 24.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 25.0 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage early Monday morning. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 25.1 feet on 05/09/2003. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Saturday morning at 1030 AM CST.
